turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Fear and Misery of the Third Reich.
turn.1: What was the leading role in Bertolt Brecht's play Fear and Misery of the Third Reich?
turn.2: Fear and Misery of the Third Reich  Fear and Misery of the Third Reich (), also known as "The Private Life of the Master Race", is one of Bertolt Brecht's most famous plays and the first of his openly anti-Nazi works.
turn.4: It premiered on May 21, 1938 in Paris.
turn.6: This production was directed by Slatan Dudow and starred Helene Weigel.
turn.7: What was the most important fact about this play?
turn.8: The production employed Brecht's epic theatre techniques to defamiliarize the behaviour of the characters and to make explicit the play's underlying message.
turn.10: The play consists of a series of playlets, portraying National Socialist Germany of the 1930s as a land of poverty, violence, fear and pretence.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Nazi antisemitism is depicted in several of the sketches, including "the Physicist", "Judicial Process", and "the Jewish Wife".
